definitions: a saprophytic woodland plant related to wintergreen, lacking chlorophyll and bearing one or more waxy bell-shaped flowers.

notes.text: Two species in the family Monotropaceae (or Pyrolaceae): the yellow or reddish Monotropa hypopithys (also called false beechdrops), common in eastern North America, and the pinkish or purplish violet-scented Monotropsis odorata (also called sweet pinesap)

shortDefinitions: woodland plant related to wintergreen, lacking chlorophyll and bearing one or more waxy bell-shaped flowers
